column4: Hi. How can I make rsync to not overwrite permissions on destination host?
-p
I tried -p but it preserves permissions from the local host... and try to overwrite destination's permissions. I want to preserver destination's permission
-p preserve permissions ( from source ) if you don't it don't use -p nope?
okey...but its already preserving from source... and I don't use -preserve...
or you can use --chmod or -p with -A = acl
so you get some permission error when execute rsync?
I use -zrv and --delete
try using --chmod= with permission that you want
--chmod=666
but what kind of filesystem host have
ext3
ok
there are many option about permission on rsync
I guess so...but why will it try to preserve permissions if.. i dont ask it to do so...
so try to set your permission with --chmod
can I also change remote group ownership with rsync?
p3rsist -o owner -g group
-o super-user-only
look at the man rsync
so I think that -p preserve permission on destination, not from source
well I made some test, you can change permission for group and others, using rsync -rzvp --chmod=g+rwx,o+r /source/ destination it sets drwxrwxr-- on destination, you can't change owner
--chmode needs -p
Thanks
